Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>### Input:Google Maps and other highway and street GPS services have replaced what? Choices:  A: united states B: mexico C: countryside D: atlas E: oceans<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Input<n>In the next 200 years, scientists predict that global warming will cause sea levels to rise enough to flood low-lying coastal cities and towns, endangering the homes of millions of people. Where will most people migrate? Choices: A: inland B: to the countryside C: to a new city D: on a different planet E: some combination of the above<n><n>### Response<n>A<n><n>### Input1:The city of Philadelphia in Pennsylvania has a population of about 1.6 million people. In 2000, the median household income—the figure in the middle after the income is ranked from highest to lowest—was $29,000. How many households in Philadelphia have a median income that is higher than the national median household income? Choices: A 1 to 25% B 51 to 75% C more than 75% D less than 25%<n><n>### Response1:B<n><n>### Input2:The city of Cincinnati, Ohio, has a population of about one million people. In 1999, the median household incomein the city was $36,000. The national median household incomein 1999 was about$ 37,000. In what range of numbers (in thousands of dollars) did most of Cincinnati's households have a median income? Choices:A the same as the national median  or less B 1 to 20 C more than 20 thousand D more than 200 thousand<n><n>### Response2:C<n><n>### Input3:In 1994, more Americans were employed in professional and business services than in any other occupation or industry. They made up 14.9 percent of the workforce. By 2007,how much more likely were Americans to work inprofessional and business services?a 1 to 24 percent b 52 to 75 percent c 76 to 99 percent d 100 to 24 percent<n><n>### Response3:A<n><n>###Input4:Hurricanes cost Florida nearly $1 billion a year in lost wages and property destruction or damage. That's more than three times as much as

How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>### Input:The forgotten leftovers had gotten quite old, he found it covered in mold in the back of his what? Choices:  A: carpet B: refrigerator C: breadbox D: fridge E: coach<n><n>### Response:		<n>Refrigerator    <n><n>### Input:"What do you want out of life?"  A few weeks past since, he didn't even know if he even knows. He had already answered, but that didn't matter.  One question was he would have to go to was what kind of job he would like to have?  Choices A: Coder B: Bussing tables C: Truck Dashboard Designer D: Software Engineer E: Tech Support<n><n>### Response:"Coding"<n><n>### Input::A man is having dinner with his wife at a nice restaurant, when the waiter comes and takes their orders. The man, who orders a burger, turns to his wife and says "That waiter makes me crazy! I want you to order whatever you want." The wife answers: "Okay"  She then, proceeds to order food and drinks. As the meal progresses, she begins to feel uncomfortable with how little the man is eating. He appears to be very tired as well.  When the waiter brings the meal, she inquires, "What's wrong with him??" The husband responds "The last thing he needs is me complaining how long it takes him to bring the burger and the other food. He works very hard and it wouldn't be nice to make him feel bad." The wife feels bad about what she was going to do and orders a meager meal to take home for the rest of the family. It was a good choice not to bother the waiter with silly things. She then proceeds to apologize to him about being annoyed by how long it takes him. The husband is pleased and tells her it is acceptable. <n><n>### Input <n><n>### Answer <n><n><n>### D.<n>>What's wrong with the man<n><n><n>#### Input <n><n>#### Answer <n>"Never the first question you ask."<n><n><n>#### D.<n>>How does the woman feel about having to be quiet?<n><n><n>#### Input<n><n>#### Answer 1<n>It is acceptable.<n><n>#### Input 2<n>It's okay<n><n>#### Input 3<n>That's acceptable with me.<n><n><n><n>#### Input.<n>#### Answer <n>He makes the food.<n><n>### Input<n>A: He had to wait 5

If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>### Input:He wanted a house that was gated off from other places, where should he start looking? He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>### Input:What does sex often make happen in people? For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>### Input:WHat do cats get into when they are ripping things apart? Choices:  A: dog's mouth B: floor C: garage D: trouble E: nature<n><n>### Response:		The first word is garage, the last letter in the word is k. The middle letter is o and it is next to the first letter. The third and fourth letters are a and t. The second and fifth letters are A and D.<n><n>### Input<n>Which of the following is a three digit number with it's units and tens digit at the same digit. Choices: 100 200 300 400 500<n><n>### Response<n>Three digit number is a three digits number. Units digit is in the units place. Tens digit is in tens place.<n><n>### Response to the above input<n>The only three digit number whose units and tens digits are the same digit is 357<n><n>### Response of the above response<n><n>The only three digit numbers with their units and tens digits the same are 357<n>

Friday, I was in school studying my math because tomorrow is Saturday. <n><n>####Paragraph 10<n>On Saturday, I ate spaghetti with my Mom and we watched Saturday morning shows. My favorite food is hot dogs. <n><n>## Solution:<n>### The task request was to perform the given mathematical operations. (The answer should contain no fractions or decimals). Write your answer in expanded form.`<n>### Demonstraion:`2 \times (x-125) / 3 = 2x/3 + 2 \times 125/3 = 2x/-41/3 = -4(5x/-41/2)/3 = 320x / - 190`<n>### Response:320x / 210<n><n>### Note:`This problem has been provided buy a community of learners.`<n><n>### Instructions:`Please review your work using a graphing calculator.`<n>### Response:``<n><n>### Instructon:`Please find the value of x that satisfies all three conditions in the following set. If there is more than one possible value of x, then you do not satisfy any of the conditions.`<n>### Values: 1 \div x = 2 \div x 1 + x = 2<n>### Demonstiation:`1 \div x = \frac{1}{x} \leq 2 \frac{1}{2} = 0.5 x = \frac{2-2}{2-1}= 0.5 `<n>### Note:`Please find the value that satisfy all three conditions in the above example.`<n>### Response:0.5

A skydiver is in the free-fall area of time.<n><n>### Input<n>A: At the beginning of class, a box contains 100 pieces of candy. The teacher gives 3 pieces to each student. At the end of class, the box contains 6 pieces of candy. How many students were in class?<n><n><n>### Response<n>How many students were in class if at the beginning of class: there were 100 pieces and at the end there were 6?<n><n>```javascript<n>var candy = 100;<n>var pieces = candy/3;<n><n>for (var i=0;i<pieces;i++){<n>  pieces = pieces-1;<n>}<n>```<n><n>### Instructions: Answer all parts.<n>Complete the following table identifying the types of each geometric shape.<n><n><n>```javascript<n>//Triangle<n>var triangle1;<n>var triangle2;<n>var triangle3;<n><n>function triangle(){<n>  tri1 = document.getElementById("triangle1").innerHTML;<n>  tri2 = document.getElementById("tri2").innerHTML;<n>  //do the same with the triangle3<n>}<n>triangle()<n><n>/* Rectangle */<n>var rectangle;<n>var rectangle1;<n><n>function rectangle(){<n>  rec1 = document.getElementById('rectangle').innerHTML<n>  rec2 = document.getElementById('rec2').innerHTML<n>}<n>rectangle()<n><n><n>//Circle */<n><n>//function circle()<n>//{<n>//  circlei = document.getElementById('circle').innerHTML<n>//}<n><n>/* <n>//Plain */<n><n>function plane(){<n>  plaini = document.getElementById("plane").innerHTML<n>  var plane2 = document.getElementById(plaini).id<n>}<n>```<n>### Instruactions<n><n>### Inputs<n>  There are 2 dogs in the park: Bobo and Bella. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>### Input:Where is a fox likely to be caught? Choices:  A: tennessee B: inside joke C: grassy field D: the forrest E: england<n><n>### Response:		<n>C<n>

Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>### Input:James complained that Alexa's electric guitar was too loud and he couldn't get any work done at home,  so she decided that she should get an acoustic guitar. Choices:  A: look beautiful B: be happy C: change quickly D: occur here E: surprise us<n><n>### Response:		The correct response depends on which of the choices is chosen. If B is chosen, then the response will be D. If A is chosen, then the correct response will be E.<n><n>### Detailed Explanation:<n>A:D<n><n>### Inputs:<n><n>### Response<n><n>### Detaied Explanatioon:<n>If the choice is given, D, then the response should be:<n><n>### Correct Response:<n><n>D<n><n>### Deteiled Explanation:<n><n>If the choice is D, then the detailed explanation will be:<n><n>## Detailed Explanation(A)<n><n>- Correct word is "happy", not "happening".<n><n>## Correct Word(B)<n><n>- Correct way to write the response is "is", not "is".<n><n>## Detailed explanation(B)<n><n>If the choice given is B, then, Detailed explanation of the question will be:<n><n>- "happy" will be the correct response.<n> - "happening" must not be chosen.<n><n>## Detailed exlanation for C<n><n>If the choice chosen is C, then, the detailed explanation of the choice must be:<n><n>- Change.<n><n>- Surprise.<n><n>## Detiled exlanation for D<n><n>If the choice selected is D and the input chosen is 'beautiful' then, the detail explanation of the response must be:<n><n>A: 'is' will be the correct choice.<n>'is' will be the detailed explanation.<n><n>- Be.<n>- Change quick.<n>- Occur here.<n>- Suprise us!<n><n>## Detailed explnation for E<n><n>If the choice provided is B and the 'given choices are:happiness,happening,change,occurre' and the chosen choice is 'change', the details explnation the response will be:<n><n>'Surprise us!'<n><n>## Example 1<n><n>- What is the correct response of the question? Choices: 1) D. 2) E. 3) A. 4) B. 5) C.<n><n>## Detailed Explanation:A<n><n>A is the correct response of what. And it is our job to correct those flaws.<n><n>### InputHe used the software development kit tool, what? Choices: A: SDK B: IDE C: IDEP D: IPS E: ICE<n><n>### Response<n><n>`IDE` that means Integrated Development Environment which is a tool to aid the programmer during the process of software development as this tool assists the programmer in the development process by providing a way to keep everything organized. <n><n>### InputA team is trying to reach a consensus on a plan of action during a meeting. They may be divided into which groups Choices: A: Team B: Squad C: Tribe D: Clan E: Herd<n><n>### ResponseA team is the correct answer meaning the group of the same people with equal authority and responsibility, a team may consist of two or more members. The best example is a project member where you will have a certain team that consists of the assigned members of the project.<n><n>### Output:A computer may be used on a daily basis. It might not do work on the computer that is related to office work or school work. It may play music or games. What? Choices: A) The computer is useful B) The computer may be useful C) A computer can be useful<n><n><n>### Response The correct answer is `B`, the computer is useful, and the computer may be useful as well. In that case, the computer is used for work-related things, games, or social media.<n><n>### Source<n><n>[C++ Assignment Help | Solution](https://stackoverflow.com/a/62819119)<n><n>### Reference :https://www.educba.net/object-oriented-concept-with-examples-in-cpp/<n><n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>### Input:The person put on lotion, what did they want? Choices:  A: fresh smell B: good credit C: smooth skin D: fresh produce E: headache<n><n>### Response:		A<n>- Lotion is a liquid mixture used to soften and moisturize skin.<n><n>### Input<n>A: what is the weather?<n><n>### Response<n>A: the weather is sunny! The weather will also change in a few days because it is not a permanent condition.<n><n>### Challenge<n>A: what's your name?<n><n>### Input <n>The person wants to know a word<n><n>### Response <n>Answer: the person wants to know a synonym of a word.<n><n>### Task 09<n>### Challenge<n>Tell me 5 things that the person wants to know. <n><n>Input<n>- the person wants to know how many days are there in a week? How did you know what the person wants to know? The person told you! <n><n>Response<n>The person wants to get many information. They want to know what are the days that are in a week, how many days are there a month and more.<n><n>### Subtask<n>Input: Answer the following question in complete sentences.<n>Which word is not a synonym for the word in the sentence?<n>- The word *shock* came from the *Old English* word *scecgan*, which means “to hit”.<n>- *Shock* is a synonym for *shock*.<n><n>### Input : What type of person does not prefer a career in teaching, management, or engineering?<n><n>### Sub task : The person wants to get a word that represents their personality/character? <n><n>### Response :The person wants a word that describes themselves. In the response, you can use: <n>- What is your favorite color?<n>- What kind of person do you think you are?<n><n>### Challenge: Tell the person which kind of person are you.<n>Input : How does it feel to be a teacher, a boss, or an engineer?<n>Response: Teaching, boss and engineer are not like an engineer. An engineer does not like bossing people around. The engineer likes solving problems but not to boss people around. Being a teacher is about teaching people. Being a boss is not like a teacher. Bossing people around and solving problem is two different jobs. Being an engineer is using math to solve problem. The engineer also can help people build things they might want.<n><n>##

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>### Input:Mom is tidying a house, where would she put the loose dictionary? Choices:  A: shelf B: library C: classroom D: table E: desk<n><n>### Response:		 (1 point)Answer A<n><n>### Justification:<n>Because A is the only answer choice with shelves available in a house.<n><n>### Detailed Solution:<n>Choices: A: shelf, B: library, C: classroom, D: table, E: desk<n>The Mom is tidying a classroom, there must be desk and shelf in the room.<n><n>### Input B:Mom is tiding a house and she has a book, where would she put it? Choices:<n><n>A: shelf B: bookshelf C: table D: library E: reading nook F: bed<n><n>### Response B:<n>(1 point)Answer E<n><n>### Justifiation:<n><n>Because F is the only answer choice which has a bed but a library.<n><n>### Formal:<n>I have 5 more books than Tom has. Tom has twice as many books as I am planning to buy this month. I have 40 books in all.<n><n>### Total Score:<n>0.9/0.9 = 1

Choices:  A: pay debts B: make money C: having money D: making money E: keep house<n><n>### Response:		Choice:  D<n><n>### Instructions:Use the words below to create a story that takes each item to an unidentified destination.<n><n>### Inputs: 35 and 9<n><n>### Input 1:Follow the signs to Interstate 89<n><n>### Response 1:Drive south<n><n>### Input2:The city of Salem is located south of Biddeford<n><n>### Response2:Drive north<n><n>### Instruct:Write a story similar to the story you wrote in the last task, only this time with your words.<n><n>### Story:Melvin got off the bus and found that he was lost. He had taken the bus from Manchester to Brisbane and found that it was winter in Brisbane and he was not prepared for it. He thought that he had gone too far, so he decided to follow the signs back to Manchester, so he could rent an SUV for the winter to get to Salem, which is near his home. He followed the signs and began to drive south. The signs eventually said to turn around after traveling 6 miles.He thought that was strange, but decided to go that way, and soon he was at the exit. He had gone east instead. It was dark out, and he had to go south. He decided to just keep going and hope that he could find the highway again. He drove west for several miles until he was back at the exit. This time, he kept driving south until he was sure that he was on the correct highway for the return trip. After traveling for 5 hours, he got on a bus and paid 3 dollars 25 cents to get back to Manchester.<n><n>### Writing Rubric<n><n>#### Writing a response<n>(The rubric below is a checklist of what the writing should look like when it is completed)<n><n>| **Criteria for  <n>Checking ** | **Level of  <n>Development  ** | **Criteria  <n>for  A** | **Criteria for B** | **Criteria  for C** |<n>|:-----:|-----|:---|:---|<n>| **Clearly identifies task  <n>** | |<n><n>| | | | |<n>| | | |<n>| Writer begins with a clear  | The writer begins with a clear <n>| direction/

There you have the honey right from the bee, it can be pure.<n><n>---<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question.  <n>Input: Twice as many people from North Carolina went to Denver for a conference as from Georgia. Please mention if your answer is different from the recommended one.<n><n><n>### My Code:<n>If x is one more than y then A=y+1+x. If x^2 is one more than y^2 then B=y^2+1+x^2. A=4, B=23.<n>

The bottom part (dark blue) is the domain, and the top part (light blue) is the range of the function.<n><n>### An explanation:<n>To go from the dark blue section to the light blue, we first find 25% of the number in the dark blue, then we find 25% from the rest of the dark blue, and finally we sum both dark blue terms. He travels approximately 40 miles an hour during the day but only 25 miles an hour at night.  He has $60 in his car with him, and he is driving 500 miles total.  If he spends $30 on gasoline during the day, how much cash does he have left to use at night?<n><n>### Response<n><n>Jay is spending $30 of his cash on GAS at night.  At 40 miles an Hour during the day he has 90 miles covered before he gets his money. At 25 miles and hour at night he only has 40 miles left. Jay has $65 left. <n><n>## Instructions:<n><n>1.   Answer the following multiple choice question<n><n><n>### Instructions:<n>1.  Write a response that approprietly completes the request<n>1.  Write one additional math problem<n><n>### Response One: <n><n><n>```<n>Write an instruction that describes a math problem.<n><n><n>```<n><n>## Instrucation:<n><n>Write a response that appropriately complites the request.<n><n><n>## Instruction:<n><n>Write one additional math problem
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>### Input:The turkey needed to be kept from spoiling, what is useful in this situation? Choices:  A: refrigerator B: fridge C: freezer D: oven E: bought at store<n><n>### Response:		C

Write a response to each of the following directives.<n><n>### Directive: 1: <n>In the 1960's and mid 1970's, the US government had an active and expensive effort to promote immigration. One argument was that a country's prosperity would be enhanced by allowing highly skilled people to come work in the country. The government of the United States had a law called the H-1B. The law was to allow a large number of new employees to work in the US. Many people complained that the H-1B program was taking low-income jobs away from native-born Americans. <n>Write an essay that explains how to decide whether or not the H1B program was having the anticipated effect.<n><n>### Example Essay:<n>In the 1060's and 70's a large number of immigrants flocked to the US, taking away many jobs from native US workers because of the H1B program. The amount of low income families going up because of the jobs lost was very low so it caused more harm for the native US citizens.<n><n>### Written Response: <n>In the late 1960s and 1970s, the US government implemented an act called the H-1b program. This act allowed for foreigners to have easy access to jobs in the US and take the job away from the native born citizens. At that time many complained that the H1B program took away many jobs from the native born Americans. At first the H1B program allowed for many to come to the US and get jobs in the US that used to be held by native US citizens. However it created large number of low wage workers. To decide how to solve the issue of jobs taken away from the native US workers

Choices:  A: vent B: think C: shouting D: work off E: exercise<n><n>### Response:		<n>Exercise. If you exercise, you should get energy out of it. This might be easier for a muscle-head, but if you are tired, it is the best thing to do.<n><n>### Input<n>You should never waste time if you have 5 hours before your test.<n><n>### Response<n>I disagree with this statement. If you have 7 hours to study, you can waste time if you feel it is a waste of your time. Time wasting is usually wasteful when you have no time to do what you need to do. I also think that time "feels" wasted when you get it done in less than the time. Time in our society is based on the unit and measurement of dollars. <n><n>In terms of the 5-hour test, I see this statement as inaccurate in most cases. Some tests will take less time than 5 hours. Some tests will take more than 5 hours. The time is only an estimate of the expected time for the test. So, you should never waste time if there is no time limit because you can't accurately predict the time it would take you to complete the test. You should waste time because it is your time, and you can do whatever you please to accomplish what you want to get done.<n><n>### You make an error in your work. If you catch this error quickly, then it won't be hard to fix.<n><n>### Reponse<n>Because you've spent most of the day being busy, the idea of taking the day off is appealing to you.<n><n>### Reply: <n>I agree with this. Many people find it hard to take a day off because of being busy while doing work. If you are busy working, it is easy to neglect that you have a day off, and you should be resting. You may find that relaxing is harder because you are still busy and have to get work done. You should have days off, or you will get burned out of work.<n><n>### Question: <n>A: The average distance you drive per day in your car, in miles is x.<n>How could the statement be changed to avoid this?<n>B:  One of the two lines contains a word that is repeated twice, once as one of the synonyms. It is a word that you use to describe someone who runs. What is the word?<n>

How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>### Input:What happens when someone is playing too aggressively? Choices:  A: get hungry B: laughter C: injury D: having fun E: feeling happy<n><n>### Response:		The person becomes tired

My parents asked me to write one and I am confused on how to do it.  I'm not going to understand it unless I am shown. <n><n>### Question:<n>In a country consisting of East, North and South, the population of the three regions is 4000,4600,5000 respectively.  If the average of all the people is 5000, how many people live in South?<n><n>### Answer:<n>7000<n><n>## Example responses<n><n>### Instructio:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Demonstration:Input 5.25 + 9.5<n><n>## Response:24.75<n><n>1

Whenever you see a fox, then, it does not mean that you are in Alabama, Arkansas, Carolina, etc.<n><n>### Output:<n><n>### Explanation:<n><n>In Louisiana, we can see foxes. A paper is not on a computer.<n><n>### Input : Which of the following is a function? Choices A: a, b, c B: b, c C: d, e, f E: f<n><n>### Response : C: d, e,f<n><n>### Output : Only d, e, and f are functions.<n><n>### [Functions Definition](https://www.mathsisfun.com/algebra/functions.html)<n><n>A function is a rule or equation that gives us one output for each input. This means that if we put a specific input into a function, we will then get one specific output - this is called as a mapping.  For example, we can draw a mapping called "number guessing game" which tells us what would be our guess after we tell it how many guesses we should have. In the case of this function, for each input we put in, we would get a specific output.<n><n>### Functions Example<n><n>In a game of Rock-Scissors-Paper, if a player's Rock beats another player's Paper, then there is a 33.3% chance that the second players Paper beats the first player's Scissors. There is only a 33.8% change that Paper wins the match and there is a 32.9% chance that Scissors wins a draw. In short, we can show the odds of winning as below and they are all functions because we have one output for each input given.<n><n>A: Paper is 1,389.1 to 1 compared to Rock<n><n>B: Scissors is 302.6 to 3 compared to Paper<n><n>C: Rock is 644.2 to 1 compared to Scissors<n><n>D: Paper is 7 to 2 compared to Scissors (if one player flips Paper before Scissors)<n><n>E: Scissors is a 2 to 3 chance of a draw with (Paper,Scissors,Rock)<n><n>### Input  : Which  of the following values is an example of exponentiation? Choices: A: (100)^0.3 B: (1)^0.

About how many days will it take for his liver to make as much blood as he consumes?<n><n>### Response -<n>16 days<n><n>### Input<n><n>On Monday, Jack's bike tire has a nail in it. He gets it fixed and has a flat tire the next day. On the third day he tries to fix the nail but ends up with a small scrape. How many days does he have with a flat tire?<n>Response<n><n>### Input-On Christmas Eve there is snowfall and temperatures drop to 45 degrees or less. In the first hours of Christmas Day, temperatures drop to zero and there is snowfall.  Two weeks later, temperature rises to 20 degrees or more and there is no snow in the weather report. In total, how much time is there in the last two weeks in which there is no snow and the daytime temperature is at least 20?<n><n>### Your response -<n>Response<n><n>## Your input<n>During the rainy weather, when there's rain 25 minutes at least after it's raining, there's lightening twice as often than when during normal weather. Then there's lightening in 20 minutes after it rains. Each time it rains, there's lighting 25 minutes later. When there's lightning it rains for 45 minutes during the following hour. If there are 9 rainy days in a week, how many hours of rain does the normal day have during which there's lightning at least once per day?<n>Response<n><n>Output

Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>### Input:If they were celebrating the occasion, how could the occasion be described? Option A: 2 & 3. <n><n>### Response2: 4. <n><n>## Questions:You will be given a set of numbers. Choices:  A: suitcase B: department store C: safe deposit box D: these twos are not safe way to transport jewellery E: lady's boudoir<n><n>### Response:		<n>> A is not  (the only option that is not a  safe way to transport  jewelry is)  <n>> "C", "D", "E", <n><n>### Instructions:<n>You have 12 hours each day, 24 hours each day, or 7 days to get the task done. You can only use the time you're given to do the task.<n><n>### Solutions:<n>1. Use a dictionary to look up the definition of "safe."<n><n>### Demostration:<n>```<n>#!/usr/bin/env python<n>import datetime<n>print('You have 12 seconds to complete the task.\n \n')<n>end = datetime.datetime.now()<n><n>print(end)<n><n>start = datetime.datetime.strptime(end.strftime('%S'), "%S")<n><n>end -= datetime.timedelta(seconds=12)<n><n>print((end-start).total_seconds())<n><n>```<n>### Input:<n><n>```<n>You have 144 hours to complete the task.\<n><n><n>You do not have the proper equipment to get  the task  done.\<n><n>You do not  have the proper equipment  to get  the task done.\<n><n>You have 168 hours to complete the task. \<n><n>``<n>```<n>### Solutions :<n>1. Use a calculator to convert days to hours.<n><n>1. You have twelve hours 24 hours or 7 days to complete the task. That is, depending on the time frame you are given.<n><n>### Input :<n>```<n>You have three hours to complete the task or two hours to complete the task, whichever comes first.<n><n>You have 76 hours to complete the task.\<n><n>You have 95 hours to complete the task, or 53 minutes.\<n><n>If I have any questions, I  can  email  you  at  your  address  from  last  week.<n><n>```<n><n>### Solution :<n>You have two hours  to see in three hours you have to do the task or 2 hours  to see in  three hours but you have to do the assignment. that is, either of them.<n><n>Answers:<n><n>### Instructs :<n>You have

If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>### Input:Someone who doesn't care about about someone else and wishes them to fail has what feeling towards them? Choices:  A: unfeeling B: negligence C: antipathy D: indifferent E: rapport<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Input; Someone who is willing or able to give time, effort, and energy to assist another is what to someone else? Choices: 1 A: disinterested person 2 B: unconcerned person 3 C: unaware person 4 D: selfish person 5 E: caring person<n><n>### Response;E<n>### Input:A 1/5 times as tall as a 3-story building. A 2/5 times as tall is a 4-story building. A woman lives on a one-story building. How tall is a woman than a 2-story building?<n><n>Answer: 6 story<n>### Input:You have 4 1/4 hours, and 6 people at the same time. In my free time, I usually play games on my computer. My current favorite game is League of Legends. This game can be played on a single computer in the same room as 9 other computers, so it can be played by 2 people who are in different locations. This game is free to download and play. The most important thing to get good at this game is to practice everyday with new strategies and with old friends. I am not a very good player, but practice makes you a better. The second thing to being a good player is to have a good teammate, for example, people that can help you win a game. That’s it, I hope you enjoyed reading, that’s the end for my explanation.<n><n>

A:.09 B:.089 C:.08 D:.27<n><n>### Response :C:.27 - 27 is 1 more than 26<n><n>### Output: Janet has 88 fewer stamps than Karina, and Karina has 283 fewer stamps than Mary,  If Karina had 40 more stamps than Janet, then how many stamps does Janet have?<n><n>### Response  : B: 135 - 67=88 Janet has 2 less than Karina's stamps, 3 times as much is 283= 88+91<n>  <n>### Output: If a train travels 13 times as fast as a car, how much more rapidly does a train travel than a car?<n><n>###Response :C: 15 times - 13=2<n>

There are twelve times throughout the entire day.<n><n>### Workflow:<n>In the task below, select a response that, by applying the mathematical relationship of recognizing and applying the numerical relationship between words, correctly completes the task request.<n><n>## Task: Answer the following multiple choice question<n><n>### Instructuion: Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>##### Demonstrition:<n>Input: "Rudolph's friends are happy to see him in the morning."<n><n>### Output: (true) There are twelve days in the month. (false) There are twelve days during the year.<n><n>### Output 1: If a student attends school in the morning, does the student also attend school in the afternoon and in the evening?<n><n>### The mathematical relationship for comparing and contrasting numbers are:<n><n>### 1) the word "times" and the numeral "1";<n><n>### 2) the word "twice" and the numeral 2;<n>### 3) the word "thrice" and the numeral thrice;<n><n>### 4) the words "four times" and the numeral fours;<n><n>### The example provided in the question, "There are twelve times throughout the day," follows the mathematical relationship to compare and contrast 1) the times of the day; 2) "times" to the words "morning," "afternoon," and "evening" and the numeral12; and 3) "times" to days in a week and months in a year.<n><n>## Demonstration:

For example, the number 4 uses `$$$` to represent. For instructions that only say input to write in the response and no explanation, it may be important to know that for the task, the input contains only numbers 0 or 1.<n><n>For example, given the task `Both of the houses' paint colors are similar. House 1's front door is a different color than its garage.\`\` \` \` \# \# \#, and the house's garage is a different color from its trim.\`\` \#\#\`, the response should be `C`. The task asks if both of the houses' paint color are similar. The task also says both of the houses' numbers colors are similar. House's one front door is different than it's garage color. The garage is similar to the wall of the house, so the two of the houses' paint is similar.<n><n>However, if the task asks to choose either `\$$$$` is on the west wall or \`\`\$\$\$\#\`\`\$ is in the front yard and gives two choices as a list such as `\

If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>### Input:What were southern institutions where slaves do the labor called? Choices:  A: farm B: ancient rome C: history book D: poor countries E: plantation<n><n>### Response:		Choice B<n><n>### Input : Which of the following words is pronounced the SAME as "PETT"?Choices:1. pet2. hat3. eat4. get5. net<n><n>### Response : Choice 1,2,5.5.4<n><n>### Input. Romeo drinks poison because Juliet is dead.5. Romeo is imprisoned because a servant of the prince kills Tybalt.<n><n>### Response. Choice 1<n>### Input. Complete the analogy.Cow:__:Rock:__Choice 1. The answer the question is Earth's mantle is 322 miles deep.<n>### Expect answer:<n><n><n>### Instuctions:Write a response to the question.<n><n>"What is Iron and the name of its chemical element?"<n><n>### Demostration<n><n><n>### Expected Answer:<n>Iron is an element and the chemical name is Iron (Fe).<n>### Demostrating<n><n>### Answer:<n><n><n>## #5<n><n>### Instructiions:Write a response using: I, or me.<n><n>### Example:I was playing basketball with John. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>### Input:What could fighting inflation cause if it is not successful? Option: A (two expressions with numbers with the same units.) B (two expressions that have the same value.) C (two expressions that equal each other.) D (two positive numbers.)<n><n>### Response:"Let's see what ___ and ___'s unit is equal.<n><n>Explanations:<n>A Two expressions with numbers, one thing that has value is A B and C are equal to each other<n><n>---<n><n># Code that should execute if a question answer is incorrect or does not meet the requirements<n><n>```<n>if (!((ans == "A" || ans == "B" || ans == "C" || ans == "D" || ans == "E"))){<n>    console.log("Input: " + question + " " + " " + ans + " " + "Correct answer:" + answer);<n>}<n>```<n>---<n><n># Solution to the Question:<n>---<n>##Instruction<n><n>##Demonstration  <n>Input: Janet added 14 and 2. Choices:  A: watch film B: play cards C: play chess D: read news papers E: surf net<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### Multiple Choices<n>B, C<n><n>#### Free Form<n><n>The answer is C and B.<n><n>Input: A: watch film<n>Output: The audience can watch film in theatre and they can also watch on television.<n><n> Input:B: play card<n> Output: The audience can play card with their family, the boredom can play by playing card.<n><n> Input: C:play chess<n> Output: The audience will play chess and they will solve boredom while playing chess.<n>### Instruction and Response:<n>Write a response that appropriately answers the question.<n><n>## Output:<n>When you experience boredome, what can you do ____________?<n><n>I can watch film, the audience experience boredome and they watch film.<n><n>I can play card, the audience experience boresome or they play card with their friends and family.<n><n>I can read news papers, the audience can read news papers in the newspaper or they can read online.<n><n><n>I can surf net, the audience can surf online to pass the time.<n><n>I can't watch film, the audience can't watch film or they experience boredome.<n><n>I can watch television, the audience can watch film or they experience online boredome.<n>

He picked a place that was inexpensive and offered few luxuries.  Where might he be staying? Choices:  A: farm B: town C: city D: hotel E: motel<n><n>### Response:		<n>> ANSWER:<n>```java<n>int[] costFarms = {50, 100, 150};<n>int[] costTowns = {70, 90, 110};<n>int[] costsCities = {90, 120, 155};<n>int[] costHotels = {35, 55, 85};<n>int[] costsMotels = {15, 35, 50};<n>```<n>```java<n>int cost = 0;<n><n>// farms<n>int[] costFarm = costFarms;<n>if (count > 3) {<n>    cost += Math.max(costFarm[0], costFarm[1]);<n>}<n>// town<n>if (count >3) {<n>    int town = Math.max( Math.max(costTowns[0], costTowns[1]), costTowns[2]);<n>    town += Math.max( Math.max(costTown[0], costTow[1]), costTowm[2]);<n>}<n><n>// city<n>if (count < 4 && count >2 && Math.max(  Math.max(costCities[0], costCities[1]), costCities[2]) < Math.max(  costHotels[0], costHotels[1])) {<n>    cost +=Math.max(Math.max(costFam.costFarm[01],costFarm[02]),costFarm[2]);<n>} else if (count < 4&& count > 2 && Math.max (costCities[0], costCities[1], costCities [2]) > Math.max (costHotels[0],costHotels[1])){<n>//hotel<n>    cost += Math.max (Math.max (costCiti[0], costCity[1], costCity [2] ), costHoti [0], costHot[1]) ;<n>} else {<n>    cost = cost + costHotel[0];<n>}<n>return cost;<n>```<n><n>### Input : There are 5 red cars on a red line in a train, 3 blue cars next to a green one on the blue line

He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>### Input:Traders work on the floor of the stock what? He uses as few orange juice bottles as possible, but at least 7 of them must always be orange. The recipes also use exactly as many orange and grape juice bottles. How many kinds of recipes can he make?<n><n>### Instructions:<n>You need to ask Takashi 2 questions to get 2 answers:<n>-How many different kinds of recipes can you make with 3 kinds of fruit?<n>-How many kinds of recipes are there with only orange juice and grappe juice?<n><n>### Demos:<n>(input : 3 recipes, two kinds of fruit, how many recipes with only orange juice?)<n>Answer(after three trials): There are 8.<n><n>* Question1 7<n>* Question2 8<n>* Question3 7<n><n>(input : 2 recipes, three kinds of fruit)<n>Answer(after three more trials): There are two.<n><n>* Question4 7<n>* Question5 6<n>* Question6 7<n><n>(asked question 6 times, but the response doesn't match the description)<n><n>### Task3:<n>Write a response that appropriately answers the question in the input.<n><n>### Input1:<n>In a classroom, there aren't enough chairs for everyone, so some students have to stand. There are 120 chairs in all. If 1/4 of the people who stand can fit in one chair, how many students can stand in the classroom?<n><n>### Response<n>There are 11 students who can stand.<n><n>### Explination:<n>You can not use response generator on a task that has less than 3 inputs, so this sentence can't be sent to response generator<n>

Choices:  A: believe in god B: pay bills C: group together D: enjoy themselves E: face each other<n><n>### Response:		<n><n><n><n>### Input <n><n>A plane leaves an airport headed in the direction of Seattle with 4 pilots flying in it. It arrives in Seattle 3 hours 54 minutes later, having traveled 3,659 feet below the ground. Afterwards, the plane takes off from Seattle with half as many pilots and flies to a mountain in Washington, then back to the airport again.  It leaves Seattle headed to Portland and travels at 1,600 feet above the ground. The plane flies into Portland and picks up 19 more pilots. The plane then takes off for California and climbs to the highest altitude, 11,000 feet above the floor, but due to engine trouble, it descends on the way to Fresno. It ends up going through Santa Barbara first, however. How much time elapsed from the beginning of the flight to the end?<n><n>### Response<n><n><n>### Instructions<n><n>### Demo<n><n><n><n><n>## Instructions:A. Write a subroutine named "sayHello()" for the HelloMoon() function. The subroutine should take one float (f) as the parameter and then print to the console. This would look like "hello <float>".<n>B. Write a subroutined named "sayHi()" that would also take a float as a parameter and print it out, but with only the words "say hello" and without the parentheses.<n><n>## Solution<n><n><n>```python<n>import time<n><n><n>def HelloMoon(f):  # The user inputted float value to compare against HelloMoon<n>  time.sleep(8)<n>  print('hello {}'.format(f,))<n><n><n>def sayHello(s=""):  # User enters float to compare with HelloMoon<n>  helloMoon(s)<n>  print(s, hello)<n><n><n>def sayHi(f=""):  # User entering float value<n>  print(s)<n>  <n>  <n>if __name__ == '__main__':<n>  sayHello()<n>  sayHi()<n>```<n><n>### Instructor Instructions<n>### Demo<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. Choices:  A: antique store B: in the graveyard C: kitchen D: junk yard E: ice<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Input<n>In a classroom, there is one desk for every three students. A classroom was discovered in the town that has desks for every four students. Which classroom must have more students?<n><n>### Response<n>The classroom with the fewer students should definitely have more students. Classrooms with three and four desks per student, each containing four students total, would mean each student has their desk. So the classroom with four desks per student would have more students.<n><n>### Input <n>Kim went to the grocery store and bought 21 candy bars, 26 cans of soda, 3 cans of paint, and 6 bags of beans. He paid $1.10 and $1.30 for every 8 cans of soda and a can of paint. He paid $1 for every 4 bags of beans and his soda and paint came to $9.10. How much did Kim pay for everything including the candy bars?<n><n>###Response<n><n>First, let's make lists of everything Kim bought. We'll look at the numbers.<n>* Candy Bars: 21<n>* Cans of Soda: 26<n>* Can of Paint: 3<n>* Bags of Beans: 6<n>This leads us to the following groups that can multiply:<n>* Candy Bards: 21 - one group<n>* Can of Pain: 3 - one group<n>* Bags of beans: 6 - 3 groups<n><n>We'll need to find some new groups that will make sense.<n>* Can of Soda: 13 of these - 3 groups<n>* One Bag of Beans: 2<n>* One Candy Bar: 1<n>We'll use these groups to find our answers. Multiplying 13 groups of 1 can of soda: 13 for each can of soda (all of these have the same numbering since we found the same number of each type) will give us 13 cans of soda. We can do the same for the bags of beans so 3 groups give us 2 bags of beans, and 4 groups of 1 candy bar will give us 4 candy bars.<n><n>Now we should solve all

Choices:  A: grandma B: clothing C: jewelry store D: clothes E: fabric store<n><n>### Response:		Clothing<n><n>### Input :It took him 15 minutes to clean a room, how long will be cleaning the whole house taking a 10% longer time?<n><n>### Response : 29<n><n>### Input Birthday: I have a birthday and 8 friends. I was born 5 years ago. 7 of my friends were born one year after I was. Alicia was born 5 years before I was. How old are we all together?<n><n>### Output: 63<n><n>`Note :If one of the person was born 27 years ago he/she wont be consider`<n><n>### Input Christmas: It's a little Christmas for me. I get 8 presents for Christmas. Three of them are dolls, One is clothes, I get 2 toys and a board game and the last one I'm not sure what I'll get. How many gifts will I get altogether?<n><n>### Solution :39<n><n>### The final code<n><n>```python<n>#!/usr/bin/python3<n><n>import re<n><n>ans = input().strip()<n><n>if ans == "A":<n>    answer = "Clothing"<n>elif ans == "B":<n>    answer = input()<n><n>while answer[:2]!= "0" and answer not in ["\n", "eof"]:<n>    answer = answer[:2] + answer[2:]<n><n>else:<n>    answer = ""<n>answer = re.sub(r"\s+", " ", answer).strip()<n>print("The answer is "+answer)<n>input()<n><n>if answer in ["a", "b", "c"]:<n>    if answer == "a":<n>        answer = "Clothing Store"<n>    if answer == 'c':<n>        answer = "Near a store"<n>    print("Final  ans is "+ answer)<n>else:<n>    print("Invalid answer.  Try again")<n><n>```<n>

He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>### Input:After bringing eggs home from the store in what are they held? Choices:  A: chicken coop B: supermarket C: box D: egg carton E: henhouse<n><n>### Response:		A box<n><n>### Input:"I'd like to go to the café" is an example of a __________.Choices:  A: complete thought B: incomplete phrase C: question D: complete sentence E: run-on<n><n>### Response:"I'd like" is the subject and "to the café" is the predicate. There is no verb before ___ the verb, because it's a run-on sentence.<n><n>### Input:'Jane's biology report' is __________. Choices: A: in need of a direct object B: incomplete C D and E are correct<n><n>### Response:'Jane's' is the subject and 'biology report' is the predicate.<n><n>###Input: After winning 8 games, the basketball team has an average of 112 points per game. "After all," the Coach says, "it only has 2 more points than its highest scoring game."  How many points did the basketball team's highest scoring game have?<n>Answer: <n><n>### Instructions:<n>Complete the question. Write an answer for each question. If you don't know the answer to a question, try to eliminate choices, then guess<n><n>Input: In what country did the chili pepper come from?  Choices: A: Japan B: India C: China D: Argentina E: Mexico F: United States<n><n>Response:<n>Answer: M<n>

In the second problem it's assumed that he rode the bus less than 20 blocks. This doesn't always make sense, because if he'd have rode the bus a shorter distance, this would mean that he walked a longer distance than we are told. He might have been told to leave home at 9:00am to go to the post office to pick up the stamps then go to the post office. This should have been the first step of his journey. Choices:  A: public building B: tomb C: arena D: large building E: treasure<n><n>### Response:		1. The explorers found a temple much to their delight it lead straight to the ancient buried artifacts.<n><n>### Input 2: A train has two first class compartments and four third class compartments. How many people are there in the two first class compartments if the total number of passengers in the all the three compartments is 74?<n><n>### Response 2: A train with 74 passengers has three compartments; two first class compartments each having 36 passengers and the other compartment having 28 passengers<n><n>### Input3: There is 1/3 as many apples as oranges and more peaches than both combine.  A lunch lady brings 12 apples and 8 oranges to the school cafeteria. She also buys 5 more apples and 2 more oranges. The lunch lady buys three times as many bananas as oranges. What is the total number of bananas, apples and oranges?<n><n>### A: The total number of bananas is ( 12+8+5+3 ) that is 28<n>B: The total number of apples is ( 12 + 8 +10 ) which is 30<n>C: The total number of oranges is ( 5+ 2 ) which is 7<n><n>### Thus, the total is 30 + 28 + 7<n><pre>This is equivalent to 55 oranges, 83 apples and 25 bananas.</pre><n><n>### Input4: For every pair of socks, there are either 1 or 2 underwear and 1 or 2 pairs of underwear and 2 or 3 shirts. If you buy 2 shirts less pairs of underwear then you have an extra 13 pairs of underwear, 5 more pairs of shirts and 2 more socks. What is the total?<n><n>### This is how the response will look like<n><n>### A. First, for every shirt there are either 1(socks and underwear) or 2(Socks, Underwear, Shirt).<n><n>### As the number of pairs of underwear will be same as the socks.<n><n>### Therefore

Choices:  A: plain B: cold C: dull D: bad E: wet<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>### Input:[Input #2]<n>How many of these people are smokers if there are 21 teens, 8 adults, 3 children, 3 other people and 1 other person<n><n>A:  6  <n><n>### Response:[Input #2 #4]<n>1.  9 of the teens are smokers.<n>2. There are 7 adult smokers.<n>3. There are 5 child smokers.<n><n>### Input:#3<n>How many miles did the person bicycle if the person travels 24 miles in 1/3 the time it takes to travel 40 miles?<n><n>### Response:#3<n>The person bicycled 48 miles.<n><n>### Answer<n>Even though all answers were correct, there were some that were overly simplistic. The idea of a task was to solve for a number in the context of an interesting and complex question and then answer with data that the students can relate to. In some of the examples, the correct response was based on an assumption that went unstated. For instance, there is no explanation in the task of what "dull" means. Or why there were no numbers associated with each individual character - like "3 other people and 3 other individuals". I think this adds in a layer of complexity - something that I think is a good idea as math is inherently about rigor rather than memorization.<n><n>### Assessment<n><n>---<n><n>### Suggestions for improvement<n><n>---<n><n>I wanted to make sure that the tasks and how they are answered could be understood without additional materials. To help ensure this, I'll be adding images of the answers to my solution files that the students saw on the whiteboard.<n><n>---<n><n>My next iteration would be to add more questions to this activity and more practice with these types of questions. Since I have more practice questions, I would be inclined to reorganize and add more variety in the order of tasks and questions.<n><n>---<n>

The woman lost. In the 2016 election, the Republican party could only find a man to represent them. That would mean that if a woman ran as a Republican in 2018, she would be the party with no representation on the national ticket. But in 2016 there was a woman on the Republican national ticket. How is that possible?<n><n># 13:<n><n>The United States has two major political parties. One of them is the Republican Party. The other is the Democratic Party. When a person runs for president, one of them will run against that person. One of those parties is the Democratic Party. The other one is the Republican Party. If the Democratic Party wants to nominate its presidential candidate, it has to have a primary. There are three major states that hold primaries. They are Iowa, New Hampshire, and South Carolina. In the past few elections, Iowa held its primary earlier in February. New Hampshire and South Carolina have also held their caucuses and primaries earlier in the year. But this year, all three states are scheduling later primaries in order to save money. Why would they want to do that?<n># 14:<n><n>A group of people in a certain country had a big problem. Two of the country's leaders had been in control for a long time. They decided to try to elect a new leader. A few people ran for president. These parties are the Republican Party and the Democratic Party. Who was the leader that they were trying to replace?<n># 15:<n><n>When a woman ran for President in 2013, she was very popular because she was so good at her job. In 2016, a woman ran again but she was not very popular with voters. What happened to her popularity?<n># 16:<n><n>If someone is called a member of the Democratic Party or the Republican Party is called a member of what Party?<n># 17:<n><n>A man is running for president. He wants everyone to vote for him. In the past, some people were told that they could not vote. This made it difficult for him to win. Today, no one is allowed to stop anyone

Which of the following does NOT make the same comparison?<n>  (Choices:  A: sick people B: hospital C: illness D: sick people's house)<n><n>### Response:(Choices:  A, C, D )<n>  2. "A" is to "C" as "B" is to "D" and, the same for "A", "B" and "C", and, "B", "C", and "D". So in the last set of statements, both are true. So, the one that is not, is "(B), "C", "D"<n><n>### Input:[Fred, Diane, Bob] * 2 is equal to [Harold, David, Mike]<n><n>### Response:[Fred, Diana] * 2 is [Harold, David]<n><n>### Input:`3 ^ - A` is -25. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>### Input:Which entrance would you use if you do not want to use the back entrance? How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>### Input:The man was eating lunch, but rushed when he looked at his watch, why did he rush? Choices:  A: gain weight B: late for work C: heartburn D: bad breath E: early for work<n><n>### Response:		Because he is late for work.<n><n>

How much did Alicias store make?<n>Answer: $1500<n><n>Input: Chloe walked 15 blocks from her house to a grocery store. She walked from the grocery store 7 blocks to her mother's house. An operation can have the properties of associativity and commutativity.<n><n>### Which of the following statements are both True and will NOT change the order in which the output was generated?<n><n>### The input values of a sequence are called the <n>### The  of this sequence is <n>### The following statements are both True.  Select one value from the group to complete each statement.<n>### To write a mathematical formula is to write what it means, which is to make words into numbers.<n>### Input: In his first ever stockpile sale, Michael has a set of 10 shirts that he wants to get rid of by finding a buyer who will pay him for all the shirts. Because of his mistake, he spent 8 years somewhere. Where was he? Choices:  A: prison B: bridge C: locked up D: homeless shelter E: neighbor's house<n><n>### Response:		<n>The question is ambiguous - what does "somewhere" mean? Ben could be in jail, prison, a bridge, his father's home, a neighbor's home, a homeless shelter, the hospital, a locked room, or a place his wife doesn't want him. I will answer that Ben spent 8 years in a homeless shelter after a motorcycle accident when he was drunk.<n><n>### Note<n>To make this less confusing, you can use the built-in `where` function to replace the word "somewhere":<n>```ruby<n>puts "Ben was an alcohol. He spent ___________ after a motorcycle accident".where('A','B','C','D')<n>puts "Ben spent 8 years in ___________ because of his mistake. What was it?" where('E','A','B','C')<n>```<n>### Output:<n>Ben was an alcohol after a motorcycle accident.<n><n>In a homeless shelter because of his mistake.  What was it?<n>Ben spent 8 years homeless after a motorcycle accident because of his mistake.<n><n>### Extra Credit: (A.k.a. the more fun part)<n>If you want to play with the code a little bit, you can add a new method to the program with a name, and then put it in a file by itself with no file extension.<n><n>### Explanations:<n><n>Here's what our program will do. `input` takes a string and splits it into an array using the split method. It checks if one of the words is `E` (the output), and if it is, then it puts out the result.<n><n>### Sources<n>1. https://www.theodysseyonline.com/8-multiple-choice-questions-write-correct-answers<n><n><n>

How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>### Input:What's it called when you have seen something through an eyepiece? If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>### Input:Joe bought a ficus.  He thought it would look good in what part of his home? Choices:  A: family room B: tropical forest C: flower garden D: movie theater E: hair salon<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n><n>

Arrays index elements with the indices [0] to [n-1] where n is the size of the array.<n><n>### Input How do you convert 8 to a binary number (base 2)?<n><n>### Response Write an IF statement as shown in the following example.<n><n>### IF (7 > 5) THEN "The number is great"<n><n>### IF-ELSE (8 < 7) "The number is unimpressive" "The number is great!"<n><n>### IF ("The number is great" THEN<n><n>### INPUT How do you convert a number to binary?<n><n>### Output the following in 2's complement representation: 867<n><n>### Explanation Explanation: Binary represents numbers as a series of powers of two. 8 is the power of two twice (2X2X2X2) the number being 4. If we take all but the right most bit off of binary(8) we get the answer.<n><n>### INSTRUCTION What is the length of string containing the symbols 'a', 'b', 'c', 'd', 'e', 'f', without the extra whitespace<n><n>### INSRUCTION What is the sum of the first k multiples of a prime number (>1)<n><n>### INSTUCTION Convert a binary number into its two's complement representation. Input: 867 in binary<n><n>### CONVERT EXPLANATION Explanation: When converting from binary to two's complement we need to subtract the right most 1 to get the correct representation. The representation of a binary number in two's complement is obtained by replacing each one with the two's complement. The representation of a one is all ones, the representation of a zero is zero and the representation of a one is a zero followed by all ones. <n><n>### INTERVIEW EXAMPLE<n><n>### INTRUCTION Convert a binary numbe into its two's comlplement representation. Input: 512 in binary representation<n><n>### IN
