He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>### Input:The shark was migrating between continents, where did biologists find it? Choices:  A: fresh water B: gulf of mexico C: open ocean D: television program E: coral reef<n><n>### Response:		 The shark was migrating across the continents according to biologist, therefore D is the answer.<n><n>### Input<n>How many 5-pound bags of dog food are needed to make 16 25-pound bins?<n><n>### Response<n>To find the answer, the answer would be to multiply 16 with 5 and then multiply by the number of 5 pound bags needed. The answer could also be multiplied by 4 because it is 4 times 5.<n><n>### Comment:<n>How can you tell which one of the students is in second period?<n><n>### Input 2: There are two students in the class.<n><n>### Response 2: Second period is Mr. Smith's second class because there are two students at that time. This is according to the information given.<n><n>### Question<n>The square root of 9144 is <n><n>### Input-2<n>If you divided 950 by x, the remainder is 42. What is x?<n>Input-5<n>The remainder when 5 is divisible by y is 2. What is y.<n><n>### Answer 2-5 2 divided by y is.<n><n>### Answer<n>The remainder when the square root of 950 is thatched is 42. The squareroot of 950 = 9144/2^5 = 914 x 2^5<n><n>### Comment 2-5<n>5 x 42 is 220

If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>### Input:What type of water transportation is human powered? Choices:  A: turn away B: let down C: have to sleep D: run E: row boat<n><n>### Response:		Let down<n><n>### Input : What happens to blood pressure when an athlete gets nervous? Choices:  a : the blood vessels shrink b : pressure is reduced c : blood vessels dilate d : pressure is increased e : it stays the same <n><n>### Response : Reduces<n><n>### Input<n><n>How many of the following are prime numbers? 1, 2, 3, 5, 7, 11, 13, 17, 19 <n><n>### Choices:     <n>  * a : 2,3,5,11,19    <n>  * b : 7,11,13,17    <n>  * c : 3,5,7,13     <n>  * d : none of the above    <n>    <n>### Response : b<n><n>### Input 4: A baseball game has 9 outs. If a runner is out on the 1st out, a runner may only get out on the 10th out. If a runner is allowed to get out on any number of outs, the games could easily go on for hours.<n><n>### Inputs (from [https://code.org]): <n>  * A game might have<n>  4 outs if that game has 3 outs and 4 bases (not likely but possible)<n>  10 outs if a single play runs from 1st to 10th base (not likely but possible). <n><n>### Input (From text): <n>  * If the game is limited to 2 outs, there will only be 10 of them (9 bases). <n>  * A single play can't run from 1st to the 10th base<n>  * The game is likely to be more exciting if there are only 10 outs <n>  * If a runner is out only on the 10 out, then the game will take 6 play cycles, so a single game of such limited outs will probably be around 3 hours long. <n><n>### Selection: a<n><n>

Choices:  F. 6 A : 2<n><n>### Response A<n><n>### Instrumentation:Answer the following essay question.<n>### Demonstraison:<n>My teacher is an engineer at NASA who designed the Mars Rover.  While visiting my class, she showed us a model of the rover and told us about the various parts.  The rover is a 4 wheel vehicle but instead of four wheels, there are six.  They are spaced 3 ft apart and connected to the frame by arms the length of 15 ft. The distance from the ground of the rover to the top of each arm, in total, is 16.5 inches.  The arms have a 90 degree bend at the joint, where the 6 wheels meet, then the arms straighten out again.  The height of the bend in each arm is equal to the width of its wheel.  The width is 23 inches to allow for easier travel around objects (trees, etc.) on the planet.  The bend of each arm is at a point of 22.5 inches along the length of the arm itself.  We measured the wheels, arms, rover, the space between the wheels and the ground and were able to compute the following:  Height, 17 inches width 26 inches, 2

After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>### Input:Why would a company be going public? Choices:  A: switzerland B: pennsylvania C: picture D: asia E: austria<n><n>### Response:		Answer must be in bold. <n><n>### Instructions:Create a program that responds to a request above by performing the task. Your program should ask for a string of choices in the following form: Choices:  A B C D E followed by a string of choices such as Switzerland etc. Your program should make an appropriate choice based on the format of the string.<n><n>### Example: For "A B C D E" the example program would ask you to choose something from a list of four items. Then the program would choose from a smaller list. If the 2nd choice had been "B", then 3, 5, 17, 43 could be considered as choices for the 3rd choice. But a choice of "17" was not allowed as it was larger than 4.<n>#### A: B C D E<n><n>- Switzerland<n>- Pennsylvania<n>- Picture<n>- Asia<n>- Austria<n><n>#### Answer: Switzerland<n><n>#### B: A C D E<n><n>Choices:  Picture B D Switzerland<n><n>Answer: Picture<n><n>#### C: A B C D E<n>Choices:  Switzerland Picture D Switzerland<n><n>Answer Switzerland<n><n>### Submission Requirements:<n><n>- File: Use the file type `.txt` to upload your file.<n><n>- Submission Link: Click the 'Submit your Soluce' in `Lesson 54 - Multiple Choice` to submit your work.<n><n>- Program: Submit your program that you created and tested.

How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>### Input:What do people look for when competing against someone? What does it add up to?<n><n>### Instuctions, Example Answers:<n>1st term: -4<n>2nd term: 1<n>3rd term: -48<n>Add the first two: -52<n>Add the three: -90<n>Add the four: -132<n><n>The arithmetic sequence is 52, 23, 59, and so on. The series adds up to 193.<n><n>### A sequence is a list of numbers that are related.<n><n>1st Term: -8<n>2nd Term: -6<n>3rd Term: 0<n>4th Term: 2<n>5th Term: -4<n>6th Term: -1<n><n>### Input A 25 kg sack cost $2.15. <n><n>### Response B 30 kg sack cost $6.75 and 50 kg sack costed $4.75<n><n>### Input The distance to the store is twice as much as the distance to the park. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>### Input:The artist didn't use many colors to capture the view, he was famous for his very plain what? Choices:  A: landscape B: east side C: countryside D: middle america E: georgia<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>### Input<n>The artist didn't put many colors to capture the views, he was renowned for his straightforward east side.<n><n>### Output <n>The artist didn's put many colors to capture view, but was renown for his straight forward east side.<n><n>#Write code that takes input and prints an answer.<n>

If enough rainwater collects, it will burst forth to form a flower in the shape of a  bird or bunny. What  color is the flower usually?<n>(B) In which year did the world's first bionic eye implant help a blind woman to regain her vision?<n><n>### Response:(A)Pink<n><n>### Input :(B)1999<n><n>### Input :What is the fastest speed ever recorded in the history of man? This was achieved by who?<n><n>### Response : A:1435.4 miles per hour. B:Barry Sheene<n><n>### Input (Choose as many as you can) : In an experiment, a cow was hooked up to an electric meter to see how much juice she actually used. She had been in there about two hours and her juice meter read about 1176. What is her name?<n>A:Moo Mooc,<n>B:Cow Moove,<n>C:Moovella,<n>D:Cow,<n>E:Hey Cousin<n><n>### Response (Choose as many people as you can from the above list) :A:Cow Moove<n><n>### Input(Choose as many as 25) :In a study, 919 women were examined to see if they could recognize their own faces in a picture. The results revealed that, while men can easily identify their own face, women could only do so 97 percent of the time. What does this experiment demonstrate?<n>A: Women can recognize men's faces, but men can't recognize women's faces.<n>B: Men can recognize women's faces, but women can't recognize men's faces.<n>C: Men can recognize women, but women can' t recognize men.<n>D: Men who look in the mirror can recognize their faces, but women who don't look in the mirror are likely to confuse their face with a stranger.<n>E: Men can recognize women in a photo, but women can' not recognize men in
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>### Input:Where would you hear a viola along side many other string and brass instruments? Choices:  A: symphony B: band C: create music D: orchestra E: string quartet<n><n>### Response:		D: orchestra<n>### Output:<n>Orchestra<n><n>### Instructions:Choose the lettered choice that is true about the question.<n><n>## Input:How many times is 6 times as many as 1? Choices: 7 3 11 6 8 2 27 2<n><n>## Output:<n>7<n><n>## 6 out of 10<n>### InstructionA:<n>How many times is 7 times greater than 0.4?<n>### Response:<n>64<n>### InstructionB:<n>How many times greater than 3 is 6 times as great as 1?<n>### Response(InstructionB to InstructionA):<n><n>## Instructions:<n>Input: If a dog ran 1 mile per minute during one hour, how far did the dog run? Choices:  9 7 3 2 27<n><n>Output:<n>15<n><n>Input: A dog ran 27 miles in 2 hours, how many minutes did it run every mile? Choices: 2 6 7 18 12<n><n>Output:<n>6<n><n>Input: How many times as much is 15 as 3 times as much as -4? Choices: 4 18 15 11 57<n><n>Output: 15<n><n>Input : Is 40 more than 3 greater than 5 less than 2 times 5? Choices: 5 4 3 19 30<n><n>Output:<n>4<n><n>Input: Is 10 years older than 5 times as many as 20 times as many as the total of 18 times as many as Mara’s age, plus 7 times as many as 7? Choices: 10 8 1 11 19<n><n>Output: 64520<n><n>Instruction: What is 28 times as great as the square root of 836? Choices:  A: diary B: city C: bible D: graffiti E: labyrinth<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Instructions:Read the passage then answer the question.<n><n>## Words to Know:<n><n>### Adverbs<n><n>adverb	:	an word that modifies a verb, an adjective or a another adverb<n><n>-	He drives on the 1st Saturday of every month.<n><n>-	The girls are swimming fast today.<n><n>### Antonyms<n><n>antonym	:	another meaning of a word<n><n>-	The man is a businessman because he works very hard.<n><n>-	She is a doctor because she works hard to heal people.<n><n>### Conjuntions<n><n>conjunction	 : joining words that connect a sentence<n><n>-	But, and, or, if,because<n><n>### Compound Sentence<n><n>compound sentence	:	a sentence made of two simple sentences<n><n>-	I saw him and you.<n><n>-	He was fast, but I was faster.<n><n>### Definition<n><n>a word or phrase you define using the words in the sentence<n><n>-	A cat is a feline mammal that is furry, has paws and whiskers.<n><n>-	A human has toes and fingers.<n><n>### Dictation<n><n>the repeating of a text<n><n>-	She drives us to work in the morning and back in the evening.<n><n>-	I heard the teacher tell the class that we can’t park on the grass.<n><n>### Directions<n><n>The direction tells how to complete a task<n><n>-	Grab a pen, and watch the clock. What time do you go?<n><n>-	Read on page 107, and fill out the sentence with the correct word.<n><n>### Fill in the blanks<n><n>A sentence that has a blank space waiting for a new word to make complete.<n><n>-	You are not allowed to run in the hallway and the library. You have to walk.<n><n>-	It’s not good to be rude to other people.<n><n>## Modals<n><n>a word used with other words to change the meaning of the whole sentence<n><n>-	Can you help me wash my car?<n><n>-	When can we borrow your car?<n><n>### Passive Voice<n><n>a sentence where the subject

How far is he after he has been driving for 20 hours?<n><n>### Answer<n>The initial distance is 40 miles.  Every hour, he will travel 40 miles.  2. Choices:  A: university B: concert C: home D: terminal E: airport<n><n>### Response:		E (airport)<n><n>### Response 2:<n><n>### Instructions:Anita buys 5 apples for $1 each. The vendor gives her a dollar back. She buys 3 apples next and gets 97 cents back. The last bunch of 5 apple cost her half a dollar.  What’s the cost of a single apple?<n><n>### Solution:  1<n><n>### Instrument:<n><n>### Demo:<n><n>### Solution :<n><n>### Instant :<n><n>### Demo :<n><n>### Solution<n><n>### Instantly :<n><n>### Answer<n><n>### Solution 3:<n><n>### Answer 4:<n>How many stamps does it take to buy 6 postcards and 4 letters?<n>Input: A, B, C, and D are playing a game. Each gets to roll a die once, and A rolls his die first. Which of the following best describes what happens next? Choices: A: A rolls once more. B: A rolls once and then exits the game. C: B rolls twice and then exits the gme. D: The turn alternates.<n><n>### Answer: E (D - the turn alternates)<n>

Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: Jimmy is setting up a garden. He has three plots: one plot for green beans, one plot for carrots, and one plot for corn. Each corn plant produces 5 times as many servings of veggies as each carrot, and each green bean plant produces half as many servings as each corn plant. If each carrot produces 4 servings of vegetables, and each plot has 9 plants, how many servings of vegetables is Jimmy growing?<n>Answer: 306<n><n>### Input:Where can you get in shape and drink at a juice bar? Choices:  A: fridge B: limejuice C: square D: gym E: refrigerator<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>D is the output.<n><n>### Input<n><n>Input: A student asked his teacher, "Which is the greater distance between Houston and El Paso, a. or b?" to which the teacher replied, "C." Is the teacher correct in his reply?<n>Answer: Yes, because "C." is not a distance.<n><n>Input: In Houston, a man has a distance of 42 miles to drive to school. He asks his dad how long it will take to get to school. The dad tells him that it takes him about half an hour to get there. How many miles per hour does his dad drive?<n>Answer: 8<n><n>Input: A man needs to get 6 groceries at the grocery store. He is able to walk at a speed of 4 miles/hour. How many miles will the man have to travel to get it all?<n>Answer: Not a whole number<n><n>Input: A bicyclist rides 6 miles farther in 20 minutes than he is able to ride in an hour. How fast does he cycle?<n>Answer: 7<n><n>Input: In San Diego, 3 students are in the same class. There are 2 less students in the class than last year. The student who graduated from the class last year is still there. How many students are in the class?<n>Answer: Not an integer<n><n>Input: One square has four sides. Another square has three sides. Which square is smaller?<n>Answer: Neither<n><n>Input: There are a number of ways to get something done by the work that you can be done. Which ways are possible to reduce this effort?<n>Answer: <n>A) I can delegate it to other people<n>B) I can avoid unnecessary work<n>C) I can work smarter, not harder<n>D) I can work harder, not smarter<n>Answer: A is possible<n><n><n>### Your Code<n><n>

Choices:  A: table B: restaurant C: cupboard D: kitchen E: sink<n><n>### Response:		You have to put your silverware in a drawer and it should be inside the cupboard;  A, B, and C are all incorrect because that's where i would put them after a meal. Drawer or cupboard are where you put away your silverware once you've done setting the table. D is incorrect, because you cant put silverware in the sink. Even if it's a dishwasher you gotta put it in the cupboard.  E is the correct answer.<n><n>### Expected response:<n>Input: Jane bought two times as many apples as carrots at the supermarket. As a teen, a car comes with a learning curve, a lot of responsibility, and a lot of risk. The most prevalent risks for younger motorists are those who are going to be the most significant. According to National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) data from 2010, teenage drivers ages 15 to 18 have a greater risk of car accidents than older motorists, accounting for 202 fatalities every year. In fact, 15-year-olds have the most fatal car accidents per mile driven, while 18-year-olds have 44% of their deaths in an accident, implying that accidents become less frequent as they get older. The fatal crash rate per mile driven is also higher for teenage drivers than other motorists. What is the total amount of money needed to build a house? There are many ways to approach building a house, but one of the most obvious starting points of each structure is the foundation. That is why, according to the Housing Education Foundation, it is very important to understand the total amount of money required for all parts of construction, such as the foundation, and to make sure the house is well built. And just as essential is to know how much it costs to build a house so you can make a budget and stick to it. It will be easier to stay on track if you are aware of the total costs of building a house so you can create a realistic budget. That is why it is the foundation of the house. Your building's foundation is the most important structure, and therefore the most expensive. According to the Home Innovations Research Laboratory, most builders estimate it costs 50% of the total price or more. But because this is the most complex part of the foundation, the cost to build a home varies greatly from state to state and city to city. How long does it take to walk around the earth? Explain how you know.<n><n>### Sales in 2012 are 6 times greater than sales in 1999. 1999 can be found on the y-axis at 2, while 2012 can be found on the x-axis at 5. <n><n>## 2: Using the graph as a guide, list one more question that should be answered by the task.<n><n>### How large was the price increase for the product from 1999 to 2012? Would it be necessary to contact the company to obtain this information?<n><n>### The bar graph does not indicate the number of sales or the price. We can assume from the bar graph, however, that the sales price does increase by 6x during this time period.<n><n>## 4: Explain why you chose the answer you chose for the question.<n><n>## 5: Write up to three "How do you know?...because..." type statements.<n>1. (5)How do you know you should take the total price in dollars into consideration?<n>Because the price is increasing 6 times from 1996 to 2010, it may come as a surprise that that there are fewer units in 2010 than in 1996.<n><n>2. (5)Do you think it is reasonable to assume that the sales in 2015 will have fewer units sold, but a higher price? Explain.<n>Yes, because if the company's price increased 6 times between 1996 and 2010 (both units and dollars), it would make sense for their price to increase at least 6 times again from 2010 to 2015.<n><n>3.
